text: Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz (born September 10, 1938) is an American indigenous rights activist, feminist writer, and historian. She is known for her 1977 book The Great Sioux Nation. She is Professor Emerita of Ethnic Studies at California State University, Hayward. Since retiring from university teaching, she has been lecturing widely and writing. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:American feminist writers Category:American political activists Category:American political writers Category:American historians Category:Writers from San Antonio, Texas Category:Mills College alumni Category:California State University faculty
title: Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz
